Nerangs.ab: ... vanaēmā drujim hōm ud urwarām kōftan ud hāwan škāftan tā wacist sar bēd āb andar kardan ud afšārdan
"At ... vanaēmā drujəm, he should strike the hōm and urwarām and hit the hāwan until the end of (next) stanza and add water and press them."
... vanaēmā drujəm. ēn gyāg hōm ud urwarām kōftan ud hāwan škāftan
"... vanaēmā drujəm, At the passage, he should strike the hōm and urwarām and hit the hāwan."

Ritual.ab: Cf. N13.11 (cf. Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 1995: pp. 88-9):
pad ēk-hōmāst pad kardag ī mad estēd tā ō tā və̄ uruuātā hād ud agar ān be hilēnd ast kē tā ān gāhān estišn kirbag nē kard estēd gōwēd

"When performing a Ēk-Hōmāst, if one has arrived to the section of tā və̄ uruuātā (Y31.1), (one has to press the hōm. If he omits it, then there is one who says that because of stopping the recitation of the Gāθās he has not achieved any merit."
